First things first. My "reviews" system is explained on a blog entry. Which can be found through my profile.
------
✦Story
Not much to story. The usual high school slice-of-life comedy with a bit romance. The quirk this time around is that most characters have rather lewd mind.
For the most part I enjoyed the sexual jokes and dia/monologues. Chuckled quite few times and as whole found it quite enjoyable.
Probably biggest 2 issues I found about this Anime would be the following. First of all, I felt that romantic progression was a bit too minimal for my taste, but that was eased for me with the finale, which wasfairly sweet.


Second issue I felt that for this type of comedy episodes were too long and felt too packed. As if 4-koma Manga got packed into 24min episodes. Here solution would been either having shorter episodes (max 12min) or have 24minutes more "full" rather than packed mess.


But do have to mention. Thank god this is light-hearted comedy Anime. If it would been a Hentai with it's specific fitting character, then I would despise this Anime as I can already imagine how such lewd-minded fairly "pure" characters would end up being mislead or used. So big kudos it being light-hearted with absolutely respectable main male character.


Another thing I have to mention that the title is quite misleading. Seriously, the "girlfriend" wasn't a bitch in any manner. Simply lewd minded. But more about that in characters section.


Anyhow to sum it up. I found the "story" the weakest point of the show.



✦Art & Sound

Animation and art was good enough, but didn't really impress me as much. Meaning it was fitting, but nothing special. Also considering how lewd dialogues this Anime had, I'm surprised how minimally it had visual stimuli or innuendos.


As for music/OST. I have to say I did for the most part didn't notice it, but when I focused more to it. It felt fairly pleasant and bright.



✦Character

Male MC - the character who had the toughest part of having being the decent guy, who is kind and caring and has to constantly keep up the straight-man slapstick comedy act whilst being surrounded by such a dirty minded women.


Our female MC - the girlfriend. Is a bit socially awkward person with fairly odd sexual mindsets. Would say she is perverted, but she is oddly "lewd" not as the rest of the cast, who are blatantly lewd minded. Anyhow, I did like her a lot. Very caring, interesting and loyal girlfriend with a little oddity element.


Now, I won't bother explaining all other characters. But long story short, most of them are virgins, who simply have really perverted mind. That well, in different kind of Anime/story/situation/world would bring a dark turn of twists and problems. But thankfully it isn't that type of Anime. And well, they fairly relatable characters. In sense that I can be also quite lewd with my mindset but I am bound to my moral compass of not going in any sort of loose relationship. So if want to lewd, do it only with one I truly care about. Other than that, fiction and mind had satisfy the lewdness. 


ANYHOW.. only characters can be defined "bitch" as title claims this word. Could be, but not necessary might be are the nurse character and the ojou-sama yuri bait. They seem the only "succubi"  around there.


There were few more "clean" characters as well.


Long story short. Characters are pure, but lewd minded. Which for the most part were quite enjoyable and fun to listen to and see them reacting.


✦Enjoyment & Overall

I think I already mentioned everything I wanted to. It's a sexual themed comedy Anime with pure, but lewd minded women, whereas the male lead character is the one with the tough part of having to put up straight man act. 


The queen of this type Anime is "Seitokai Yakuindomo". But nevertheless, in the end this Anime was fairly enjoyable and made me chuckle few times. First I wanted give it solid 6, but then I started to dwell and I felt that I enjoyed it more than I thought. Thus decided to bump up the score as I am rather soft to things I enjoy.

What a name. Every time I opened the browser and typed the name of the anime I was already laughing. Honestly fantastic job bonus points for that.
Story (7/10) surprised to say but it was good for what it was. I mean it is a run of the mill relationship with a twist. The romance itself is pretty classic.
The twist is well, Kousaka and Haruka two truly unique personalities! More info at the characters section...
Art. I have one thing to say. Great colors and character models. Congrats! Loved them! (10/10)
Sound was very good. Indeed worth an 8/10.
Character design. Before I explain I have to say thatit was OUSTANDING 10/10. Some of you are skeptical I know. Every character support or main was very well made and though out (there is only one exception and thank god she doesn't appear too much and it is Sayo).


Akiho Kousaka, amazing, truly. There is only one question for you reading this review. Do you like dirty jokes. If the answer is yes you will love her, her mother and the classy childhood friend  and little sister combo. In greater detail, she looks like a smart but inexperienced, awkward and shy girl but instead she is a closet pervert with a fantastic sense of dirty humor (just like her mother by the way).


Kanata, classic little sister  with brother complex.


Shizuku, the most amazing childhood friend. 12/10 rating just for her.


Hoshikawa, Seiya. The greatest gay friend in an anime. Fantastic looks I can see why the ladies in the school are all over him and a great sense of humor as well.


The male protagonist is an absolute classy gentleman! Haruka, what a man! Do you except a pervert degenerate like in high school DXD to make an appearance. NO!, instead you get one of the most unique characters I have ever seen.


Enjoyment 9/10. There is one thing I would change in this category, to get the perfect 10 they should have progressed a little more before the anime ended. No II don't want this to b e a hentai just show a little more passion and romance progression.


Overall, 9/10. Well deserved in my opinion.

I really do love a good comedy from time to time,  and shobitch was a lot of fun packed into just 10 episodes.  This Anime is wall to wall covered in innuendo and X rated subject matter,  so I would recommend only mature persons without disdain for low brow humor give it a go.
                Sho-bitch has a very simple story basedaround the protagonist and his love interest.  The spice here is that this anime takes that simple story and drowns it in awkward situations and adult humor.  It definitely crosses lines but is very consistent in doing so.  I would go as far as to say "parody" wouldn't be a bad genre to categorize sho-bitch,  as the toilet humor is meant to be more humorous than erotic. Despite the subject matters being mature rated the show never resorts to nudity or genuine fan service to create humor.  Sho-bitch definitely offers unique perspectives and not so typical situations from seemingly stereotypical characters.   The story  is simple, its sweet,  its lewd, and  most importantly its hilarious.  A detracting factor for me was the anime kind of built a continuity around certain situations making it repetitive, but each episode did have unique jokes and situations making it watchable till the end.


                The art is quite average and not very flashy, but also very bright and warm.  There might not be a lot going on but every scene did feel like some consideration was taken for the story they were trying to tell.  It did feel like a more modern animation and I can live with the simplicity when a "slice of life" type situation governs scenery and movement choices.  


           The the songs and sound effects were also good,  again nothing to write home about,  but everything audible down to the performances of the voice actors was perfectly fine and decently entertaining.


         The characters make this show.   I wont go into much detail about them, but everyone from the protagonist down are what make sho-bitch so hilarious.   Any other individuals or archetypes would have failed miserably for this type of parody story.  So the characters are really a tribute to the amount of consideration that went into the making of  this anime.



              When its all said and done,  I did enjoy sho-bitch .  Your  pal Grizzziff Kingsbeard drops an overall 6/10,  and that's perfectly fine. Not every anime can be top shelf, and that's  o.k. in my book.  It could have been better, but given the material it could have been a lot worse!

TL;DR: Whole anime is packed with cheeky and pervy jokes / misunderstandings. You either like or hate it.
____________
Shobitch was.. well, a pretty unusual watch. It is a harem/ecchi anime, and yet it didn't try to shove boobs up your face in every situation possible, also, it actually had a romance instead of 5 girls chasing after the same guy without anything happening.
Mainly, I would consider this show a comedy. It is packed (and I mean, PACKED) with pervy/sex jokes, and basically every dialogue is phrased in some form that it gets misunderstood by others. Of course it is absolutely needless to say that the situationswere highly unrealistic, but you wouldn't really watch such a show for its realism anyway.\n
For me, every single episode made me laugh. \n\n
All the episodes are pretty similar content-wise, so you can just give it a try - if you dislike the first ep, there's definitely no point in continuing.

I was actually fairly surprised by this anime, seeing how low of a score it had and how much hate it was getting.
I got into this anime thinking that it would be similar to many other similar animes where sex jokes is the big focus. It wasn't really like that at all and especially the first episode made me doubt whether it would be worth it to watch and if it would actually be pretty bad, it actually made me cringe with the kinda ridiculous yet not powerfully delivered jokes that were present. However, after 2-3 episodes, I found out that this was actually quiteenjoyable in its own way.


This anime does have a lot of sex jokes. That's true. However, I feel it was lacking that special "oomph" or "sting" that you usually get in an anime such as this. It was fairly slow and it wasn't really over the top like they usually are. The jokes ARE indecent for sure, there's a lot of stuff like that going on, but it wasn't high-paced and completely without a story, nor were the jokes so ridiculous that you laugh at them simply because it's something that would never happen and is so surreal you find it baffling.


I found this to be a pretty nice anime, the relationship between the mc and the girlfriend was actually pretty good, we could see it developing and it felt pretty sweet in a way. The indecency was often fairly funny as well, quite a few of the jokes were relatively clever for a show like this. I loved how concerned his girlfriend was about him, and her actions due to that, which came across as a clumsy attempt to fulfill her role as a girlfriend and because of her own jealousy, was pretty well done.


It's certainly not the best anime out there, but I think it was a really good one nonetheless, it's unusual and I feel that the low score, which it doesn't deserve, is because some people came here without understanding the nature of this show and expected something else, thus they give it a low and unfair score. I recommend this show, but be prepared that every female around will be kinda lewd or at least love dirty jokes and the whole show revolves around dirty jokes overall, yet it's still fairly slow compared to similar shows and the romance is more important and well done than in those shows as well. 8/10, undoubtedly.

I think the one who actually saw that this anime contained dirty joke and all, just take the negative comment of the others reviewer with a grain of salt. The reviewers who criticise the sexual innuendo in this anime as if they doesn't see it coming were obviously came to a wrong place. Somehow it upset me when they speak as if it is just a dirty anime. The dirty joke is meant to be the comedy part and there are also an equal part of romance in this anime as well. TO me, the romance is nothing short of perfect as Akiho and Harulove story is very good especially during the last episode. It is the kind of scene you found in Shoujo Romance.


In short, this anime is a story following our main protagonist and schoolboy, Shinozaki Haruka who finally mans up and decides to confess his love to the class rep, Kousaka Akiho. Much to his chagrin and surprise she says yes.


I know what you're thinking, its just gonna be another light-hearted romcom, and in a way it is but what Kousaka says next turns the tables on this romcom type cliche, "I'll start by memorizing 48 sex positions".


If you have seen Seitokai Yakuindomo then you will highly enjoy this as they have the same type of humour as each other. Filled with sexual innuendos and loads of anime relief this story will make you burst not just laughing; if you catch my drift.


Throughout the story more characters will be added to the fray, most of which will be, in a sense, fetish cliche characters that we find in other anime i.e. brocon, childhood friend, rich girl. This artwork is pretty good however the characters have little development as of yet.


If you are looking for a time passer, want to laugh, and can understand at least some sex humour, then this is the show for you.

Yay it's a sex comedy.... but without the sex and the comedy was bad. This is unfortunately very poor attempt to make an ecchi harem comedy based on dirty jokes. Jokes are very dirty yes, but they are hardly funny. Many of these jokes are  predictable, awkward or just boring. At first I was not sure why they felt so bad. I usually love sexually themed humour. Then I came to a conclusion that timing and voice acting were ruining most of the actually pretty delicious jokes. They were too predictable, lasted too long and they were often taken too far. In the endthey were no more jokes and it feels like some weird pervy stuff just happens for no reason. Many things that definitely shouldn't be said out loud is said out loud but it doesn't feel funny, just weird. Most puns are impossible to understand in English and most are probably not that good in Japanese either.      


Story 3: Poor love story overall. No real character development. Main character Haruka Shinozaki is boring as hell. He has no redeeming qualities really, he is "normal" guy and he likes the main girl Akiho Kosaka because she is pretty and seems smart and responsible. But when they start dating it turns out Kosaka wants to know everything about sex and be a perfect girlfriend, respectable goal I think but it seems to be an obsession. So what is supposed to be funny is this Kosaka's obsession of sex. But obsessions are not necessarily funny. It's like watching an alcoholic who drinks, it's more sad than funny. Most jokes are about Kosaka studying sexual things and talking all sorts of pervy stuff and Shinozaki trying to act normal. That is supposed to be funny. For me it was not. 


Art 3: Rather ugly art style IMHO. Animation was at times very poor quality and it was obviously low-budget. Nothing to write home about. 


Sound 3: Voice acting was at times amateurish IMHO, I think that better acting could've also saved some of the jokes. Maybe....Acting was mostly not that bad as writing or art was, but overall it was very generic.  Music was very poor. Opening song was one of the worst I've ever heard. Very forgettable ending song as well.


Character 4: Main guy Haruka Shinozaki is boring, he has no personality to talk about. Akiho Kosaka is obsessed about sex and is also pretty boring otherwise. There are attempts of cute scenes between them, but they feel mostly awkward attempts of romance that don't work. There are all sorts of pretty stereotypical side characters like clinging little sister, clinging Onee-chan from neigbour, clinging rich girl who knows nothing of men, clinging gay guy.... all these characters seem to be clinging to Shinozaki because he is so nice. This seems to mean that despite all those unscrupulous intimacies of those characters he stays as their friend. My favorite was probably the gay guy... surprisingly there is no fujoshi-character to enjoy about his interactions with Haruka (who has broken gaydar of course) which was actually quite refreshing, instead these near-BL moments made Akiho jealous. This in turn made supposedly funny scenes surprisingly serious which didn't really work that well.   


Enjoyment 6:

I laughed like 5 or 6 times total when watching this 10 episodes long show, and some of those laughs were caused simply by bewilderment. I was so surprised how bad this show was at times that it made me laugh. So I guess that can be counted as enjoyment...


Overall 4: Very forgettable attempt of ecchi/ sexual comedy, lots of missed opportunities to make it funny. Some ideas were actually nice, but in the end achievement was probably one of the worst ecchi shows ever.

I really enjoyed this anime. I was going to skip it at first because of the name alone. But i figured, "Ah what the hell, I can at least try the first 2 episodes." I was quite surprised to discover that it was funny and cute. 
Sure it had some ecchi but it was really mild compared to some other anime Ive seen. Lewd humor is abundant which i thoroughly enjoyed. On the surface it looks just like another ecchi, harem series, but when you start peeling back the layers its really quite funny and endearing. If you watch this series, take it with agrain of salt, as the romance between the 2 mc's grows subtly.


TBH the worst thing about this anime though, is the title. The title is so abrasive and vulgar that the only conclusions that i could come to about the show (based on title alone) were that the male mc was either a huge douchebag, or the female MC was a crazy, bitchy person. Neither of which is true. Crazy? Yes. Douchey/Bitchy? No.


This is just a great anime that serves as a great example of why you dont judge a book by its cover.

It was ok.
Story: The story of My Girlfriend is a Sho-bitch isn't of a developed plot, like most animes. Instead, it introduces more characters and has events occur that allow for the development of characters. I have no problem with animes having stories like this, but the only thing I didn't like as much with this anime was the constant bombardment of sex jokes. For sex joke standards, they were creative, but the frequency should have been regulated to a good Aho Girl standard. The amount of jokes in there was at a nice and steady rate. This anime, though, was kinda like the lovechild of Shimoneta and Aho Girl. It worked in some aspects, but struggled in some others.


Art: Art in Sho-bitch was hit or miss, with some scenes looking pretty good and others seeming like they needed some extra detail. Some scenes had still frames, which confused me, since they could have animated some mouth movement. However, I do like the brighter colours that they used for this anime, and each character looks vibrant and much different from each other (spare Haruka and his sister). 


Sound: If there is one thing that this anime did do pretty well, it's the sound. I didn't really care for the opening and ending as much as I would for other animes, but what caught my attention was the voice acting. I feel that the voices were expressive, and did capture the emotions at times. However, the only annoying part was the fact that the female voice actresses made erotic and sexual noises at least once every minute. 


Character: Characters in this anime were eh. You had a straight man, his "harem", a dude who could be gay, and a few other people. Overall, they all did have different personalities, but they all were only there to make sex jokes. I was fine with most characters, but the only one that stood out was Haruka as he didn't make sex jokes 24/7. He was the sole reason that this anime wasn't just sex jokes the entire time. 


Enjoyment: Although Sho-bitch feels like Aho Girl but with more sex jokes and less enjoyable characters, I did enjoy it a bit. I don't know if this is just because I'm drawn to bad things, but it did have moments that had me snickering instead of wondering why I was watching this anime. In my opinion, it was pretty enjoyable, and people like me probably would enjoy it too but for reasons different to when you'd like an anime that's good.


Overall: Well, this anime was technically just meh for my "normie watching standards", but I did find it to have things that appealed to me "cringe watcher" side of myself. So, overall, if you enjoy things that are just ok, but also do have moments that could seem interesting to people such as myself, I'd say go for this anime, but don't go in expecting too much. Now, if you're a normie (like 95% of people here), I'd tell you to probably just stick with the meme compilations and not the entire anime

The 4-koma.  A simple yet pure comedic style that has recently been sullied due to the sheer amount of attempts to stretch the original source material into a full-length series.  While yes, it can work sometimes, this is certainly one example in which having full episodes turns the experience into something that's long and hard to watch.  Yes that was intentional.  
Story:
Sho-bitch, as my shorthand for this series will be, centers (quite literally) itself around our main protagonist, Shinozaki Haruka.  One day he confesses to the school beauty, Kousaka Akiho, and instead of getting a straight answer from her, isasked what position he prefers.  Yep, it's that kind of series.  


For 10 episodes, Sho-bitch runs the gag of 'perverted innuendo comedy' into the ground ranging from attempted subtlety, to no subtlety, to just outright violating your mind with images of the sexual nature as its cast of hormone-filled teenagers bombard the screen with everything from imagery, to twisting words towards their own sexual fantasies, all with questionable motives when you step back and look at this from a 'non-comedic standpoint'.  The show pretty much only does one thing, and that one thing persists throughout the entire series thrusting its way into your memory so that you've submitted your fate to it and just go along with the flow anyway.  


In essence, the style is based around a 2 man comedy team where our main protagonist is the only straight man (and Kousaka's father, I guess) and everyone from his girlfriend to his childhood friend, and everyone in between reveals their sexual fantasy for any given situation so that everything becomes awkward for the MC, and you laugh.  Or supposed to.  While indeed comedy is subjective, Sho-bitch's presentation and execution for jokes is the same for the show's entire 10 episode runtime.  The result of this creates a stale presentation that goes from being mildly funny to kind of annoying.  But again, even that's on the individual, so, at your own risk.


While Sho-bitch attempts to be a sweet and genuine romcom as the main couple of the series gradually gets used to dating to the point that they get to the 'I love you' phase (clearly the penultimate stage in any relationship) as the episodes run by, the sincerity of those words get vastly overshadowed by the show's naturally filthy nature and attempts to be funny from that normally filthy nature.  Perverted comedy is nothing new in anime (as Seitokai Yakuindomo will attest to that), but the lack of flair and the show's crudeness become its downfall because each episode makes the viewer more and more blasé from seeing the same thing over and over again, making the viewing experience lackluster as a result.


Overview:

+/- Genuine relationship?  (Cause there is technically progression.)

+/- Just all perverted comedy 

-  Pretty much one long running joke (It would be a 'on you, aka +/-', but in this case it hurts more than helps)


Characters:


To solidify the show as a series devoted to innuendos (which really aren't innuendos by the end of it), the characters for the most part exemplify a specific...theme to add some 'variety' to the cast and make the joke 'varied', even if that doesn't help much since the presentation is all the same.


Now Shinozaki Haruka is the series's straight man.  No question about it, and he is honestly not that interesting.  His personality stems from him acting as the series's straight man and preventing whatever is happening now from going any further because if this cast was let loose into the world without any control, we would have a massive case of sexual assault on our hands.  Regardless, aside from that, he tries to be a good boyfriend and learns to try and be one for his new girlfriend despite her insinuating many a perverted thing because...I guess she's thirsty or something.  She's not really, but I guess we're supposed to get that impression.  All this leaves his personality to be stagnant because rather than really develop his character and give him more traits, he's stuck being the boring babysitter for the rest of the cast.


And...now for the rest of the cast.  To be honest, pretty much everyone else worth mentioning in this series falls into the category of 'specializing' in a particular style of perverted joke.  So here's them in a lightning round:


Kousaka Akiho: All-rounder.  Makes any kind of jokes but shows some genuineness from trying to be a good girlfriend.

Ariyama Shizuku: Childhood friend that likes making jokes but can't take any herself.  May or may not have a crush on the MC (not confirmed) and has a bust complex.

Shinozaki Kanata: Imouto who always wears something cat-like and insinuates stuff, but doesn't actually know the meaning half the time.

Saijou Rina: Oujosama-like girl who is basically a sexual predator for girls.  

Hoshikawa Seiya: Comes in very late, but makes a splash due to an omnipresent 'yaoi hand' and appreciation for shafts in his hole.  


I could go on and on, but this should give a rough estimate as to what we're dealing with her.  Characters with smaller appearances do follow this trend, so that isn't the end of what Sho-bitch has to offer.  Does this make the cast interesting?  Well, kind of.  Again, while the presentation is the same, the content at lest differs from person to person.  Is this a good thing?  Well...no.  They're all super one-note as far as I'm aware.  


Overview:

+/- Variety?

-  One-note cast across the board.


Art:


Produced by a collaboration of Diomedia and Studio Blanc, Shobitch is...not very pleasing to look at.  Aside from the violating amount of imagery (and clothing choices) from your everyday dick joke to pantsu and everything being covered in white liquid which in and itself can turn away a large part of the show's potential audience, the one thing the art lacks is consistency.


Very often character frames from one scene to another, even key frames from ones side by side to each other don't look right.  Proportions and things like placement of the eyes, size of the head, etc all beg the kind of quality control that came about during production, and as such, create a very unappealing piece to look at.  Colors are also quite blinding and don't have any variety or contrast to it having this very saturated color scheme persisting throughout the show's runtime.  I know Studio Blanc doesn't exactly have many anime under its belt, but Diomedia at least has a half-decent team working under it so that this shouldn't be THAT much of a problem.  


Overview:

+/- Lots and lots of perverted imagery

-  Vastly inconsistent art


Sound:


'Eien Labyrinth' sung by Aoi Yuuki herself poses a weirdly high standard for the show's soundtrack.  Her performance contrasts her role as Kousaka who ordinarily has a lower tone to her voice to compliment her 'kuudere-like' appearance by showing off her higher range.  Oh, and the song's pretty good.  Personally, I wouldn't say it's anything worth listening to again, as it doesn't have that 'memorability' factor that I tend to look for in a show's OST, but it's by no means a bad track.


In contrast, the show's ED, "Koi no Himitsu" by pua:re (who's basically a group of a bunch of the show's female seiyuus singing together), bears a more energetic tone that similar to its OP counterpart, is not terrible to listen to, but not that memorable all things considered.  I suppose the show's budget all went to the music rather than the art.  So I guess...that's a thing.


Overview:

+ Decent tracks


Personal Enjoyment:


As someone who read the original manga, this show at least from a visual standpoint...disappointed me.  Story-wise, it's about what I expected.  Since it was based on a 4-koma series, I didn't really expect it to be anything spectacular.  But each episode still gave me that sinking feeling of realizing "Oh we're doing this now" as scenes that I uncomfortably recalled from the source material were being replicated in the anime.  If the quality of the art had been up to what Diomedia's standards for art usually are, then I would've given this show the pass of meeting expectations so it's not great, but not terrible. But since the lack of consistency made the visual experience lackluster, I unfortunately have to dock it a couple points for that reason.  I have this joke theory that getting Aoi Yuuki to voice the female protagonist and do a song for the show took so much out of the budget that they had nothing left for barely anything due to her popularity.  I'd be amusing to think if that's the reason why the show's quality is below average.


Did I like this series?


Sho-bitch for me is kind of obligatory at this point.  It's not one of those series I look forward to, but when it's there I kinda just go "Oh, its this one again."  So it doesn't really elicit a response.  I will say that out of the entire cast, Kanata is my favorite of the bunch.  Personally, I just find her cute and vaguely amused that everything she wears on her head has to have cat ears.  Because why not.


What didn't I like about this series?


I'd be remised to say that the comedy definitely got uncomfortable at times, but I was more annoyed by the lack of art consistency more than anything.  Sure the original art isn't great, but when you make Kousaka's eyes go even more further apart than they already are, then there's a problem.


Would I recommend this series?


Even if you're a fan of perverted comedy...watch at your own risk.  The show itself adheres to the lowest common denominator, and it's pretty self-aware about it.  Despite that though, it's not really something that's worth putting on your list because the time could be used for other things.  Personally, I would've cut the runtime of each episode in half so that the series is presented more as a short since for snappy situational comedy, that format tends to do better for this kind of show.  All in all, Shobitch is a below average school romcom perverted comedy that has been done better so unless you're really interested in what these 10 episodes have inside them, I would best stay away from it.

[Spanish Review]
Empecé a ver este anime por recomendación de mi novio y mi mejor amigo, y la verdad es que no me arrepentí.
Trata sobre un adolescente, Haru, que se declara a la delegada de clase, una chica que casi siempre va sola. Ella, sorprendentemente, acepta. Pero Kosaka es algo particular... A todo le saca su lado pervertido.
Este es un anime que o te gusta o no. No hay un término medio. Es uno de esos animes absurdos pero que te doblas de risa si sabes pillar las bromas sexuales que hacen. Según las palabras de mi mejor amigo: "este anime es meme". Es risa constante,una detrás de otra. Humor japonés lleno de indirectas, oppai y fetiches de mil tipos.\n\n
A mi me ha gustado bastante, a decir verdad, es perfecto para mi mente pervertida, aunque a veces me costaba pillar alguna que otra cosa, pues lo decían con términos japoneses que o llevas un tiempo viendo ese tipo de animes, o te quedas ojiplática intentando descifrar el significado.\n\n
Mi personaje favorito es el chico pelirrojo... Que nunca recuerdo su nombre, pues es largo y complejo. Bueno, el apellido, que es la manera en la que lo llaman. Es un chico "aficionado" a los chicos que lleva detrás de sí a miles de chicas como si fueran fans de su belleza, pero él está interesado en Haru... O más bien, en lo que podrían hacer juntos. Es el personaje más divertido de la serie a mi modo de ver.\n\n
En resumen, es un anime corto, pues sólo tiene 10 capítulos, en los que pasas un rato divertido. Es perfecto para desconectar de cualquier cosa que te preocupe, o para después de haber leído/visto una historia que haya sido bastante intensa. Como dice mi mejor amigo: "es un anime que hay que ver sí o sí".

This show is... fine.
The animation itself is just good effort to be acceptable -- tolerable but just below average. There's perhaps two or three short scenes of interesting animation, the rest would is below average but not so terrible that it will stick with you for an extended period of time because of how terrible it is. It somewhat makes up for it with fairly cute character designs, and art and color design in general. 
It's extremely... tolerable. If you are looking for a romcom that isn't based around a thousand episodes of 'will they or won't they' (the couple in this show go outin the first episode), it's at least different in that aspect.\n\n
If you know what you are looking for, and what it is is a comedy about high schoolers going out, it will do fine for a watch.

Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken would fall into the category of the standard ecchi comedy which comes out every season. Unfortunately this show is average at best in a lot of departments. The main draw of the show in my opinion is it's comedy in which sex jokes are utilized. Even then, it takes until the mid-point of the series for the comedy to really get good, prior to which everything felt a little bland.
There is no meaningful story to be found here and the romance between two of the main characters Haruka Shinozaki and Akiho Kousaka is just there to mainlyfacilitate the comedy.\n
The art style was good and I thought that the ecchi scenes were well done and complimented the humor very nicely. The OST in itself is average at best however the use of soundtrack to enhance certain moments has to be noted. Also the great use of the sound effects went a long way in making the dirty jokes as funny as they are.\n
The two main characters of the show are for the most part uninteresting and this is the reason why a lot of the first half of the show felt bland to me. The show really benefits from a cast of funny side characters that ultimately makes Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken worth the watch. Some examples of my favorite side characters would be Seiya Hoshikawa and Sayo Shizumori.\n
If you are a fan of crude humor, then you might be able to get a fair amount of enjoyment out of this show. If this is not the case then I think it would be safe to pass on watching this.

Ohhh Ho ho ho...Seitokai Yakuindomo this is not...but it's trying?
Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken for LA is as a sex comedy "romcom" as a surefire hit or miss series especially with it's level of humor it always gives off.
Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken is what happens when Okusama ga Seitokaichou! perverted romance tries to shove itself into Seitokai Yakuindomo and trying to put these two together and flimsily bring up any chance of a phallic or sex joke whenever possible. Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken is essentially about Haruka Shinozaki voiced by Mitsuhiro Ichiki confesses toAkiho Kousaka voiced by Aoi Yuuki, that's it...ohhh and add some harem antics with different girls with their own *ahem* fetishes and sex jokes. 


The thing is, since LA had been conditioned by Seitokai Yakuindomo and loving many of their unpredictable sex jokes, Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken is a hit or miss comedy for LA merely because for the majority of the anime LA CAN SEE THE JOKES COMING and the punchlines are played straight so there's nothing LA has seen from Seitokai Yakuindomo and that did better, but it becomes a hit for the rare times the punchlines either crosses the line thrice or really did come out of nowhere that LA just had to laugh, yes, LA did laugh a few times in this anime, so Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken DID do something right at times.


So uhhh is there a problem?, well it's to do with Haruka and Akiho's relationship and how the sex comedy is literally in the way of their own relationship, sure it's a sex romcom and everything, it's more comedy than romance but LA JUST KNEW where this anime would be going and that would be...not that much and it's just even worse due to the other main characters of Shizuku Ariyama, Miki Aikawa, Saori Igarashi, Rina Saijou, Kanata (who's Haruka's little sister....yes they go that way), Sayo Shizumori and Seiya Hosikawa lumped in, the "relationship" is highly taken seriously. To which LA sees Sayo and Seiya's skits are base annoying, Sayo for her voyeurism fetish 24/7 and Seiya for being the typical gay archetype and being extremely blatant about it. The only interesting characters besides the main cast would be probably Akiho's parents Natsuo and Fuyumi who are essentially the future interpretations of Haruka and Akiho with expected results. 


The animation done by Diomedea and Studio Blanc is average at best at how inconsistent it is. The character designs are decent enough and how moe they look but at times the animation degrades in quality which shows up quite often and this is for a sex romcom, shouldn't this have consistent quality?..LA doesn't know, maybe there was a miscommunication between Diomedea and Blanc which caused all this. The animation is overall inconsistent.


The voice acting however is one of the only elements in Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken where LA can see any sense of strength. Aoi Yuuki is probably the best voice actor and that is because she steamrolls any of the newbie voice actors due to her even being a veteran and well known voice actor. Juri Nagatsuma who voices Saori is actually pretty decent in her reactions for the majority of her skits as well as Rarisa Takeda Tago who voiced Shizuku for similar reasons. The reason why LA says the voice acting is a major strength to Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken is merely because of HOW the voice cast knows their timing and reactions of many of the sex jokes land and alot of them land oddly enough.


Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken "tries" and LA says that loosely in being a sex romcom but is stifled by it's harem antics which LA sees as unneeded which compounded by a hit or miss comedy makes this anime rather subpar in comparison to Seitokai Yakuindomo's brilliantly executed sex jokes. Does Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken utterly suck at it's comedy, well no, does it need to?, no. As long as it even manages to make you laugh in any sense for LA, it did it's job, it doesn't need to be Seitokai Yakuindomo as much as LA compared to it many times.


Boku no Kanojo ga Majimesugiru Sho-bitch na Ken IS NOT Seitokai Yakuindomo but it tries in it's own way of being a sex romcom and it stumbles but at times it picks itself up and crosses that line....that sex-riddled line for a laugh AND IT WORKS.
